intro: Rudgea insolita, commonly known as the golden rudgea, is a striking South American plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to regions of Brazil and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Rudgea insolita is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after species in horticulture, though it requires specific care to thrive.
